Module Bsignal¶

Class Bsignal¶

signal with a x axis basis

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.Bsignal¶
bsignal.Bsignal¶

Signal with an embedded time base

This class gathers a 1D signal and its axis indexation.

This class offers a transparent back and forth mechanism between time and frequency domain.

The base is not necessarily uniform

x can have 1 or two axis

The first axis of x and y have the same length

By construction len(y):=len(x), len(x) has priority in case of conflict

setx(x) setx : set x vector
gating(xmin, xmax) gating beween xmin and xmax
setx(x) setx : set x vector
sety(function) sety : set y vector
stem([color]) stem display
step([color]) plot steps display
plot([ix, col, vline, dtype, hline, dtype, ...]) plot signal
gating(xmin, xmax) gating beween xmin and xmax
len() returm length of x axis
save(filename) Save Bsignal in Matlab File
load(filename) load a Bsignal saved in a Matlab File

Class Usignal¶

Uniform signal

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.Usignal¶
bsignal.Usignal¶

Signal with an embedded uniform Base

This class inheritate from Bsignal. The only difference is that the x base is supposed to be uniform

setx(start, stop, dx) set the x array of the Usignal (y=0)
dx() get the time step of Usignal.x
width() get the extension support of the Usignal
expand(a) expand the time support by a scale factor a
min() minimum of Usignal
max() maximum of Usignal
truncate(posmin, posmax) truncate USignal in range [posmin, posmax]
align(u2) align two Usignal on a same base
abs() return the absolute value of an Usignal
energy() calculate the energy of an Usignal
zright(xmax) add zeros on the right until xmax
zleft(xmin) add zeros on the left until xmin
zlr(xmin, xmax) This is a gatin between xmin and xmax

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.TBsignal¶
bsignal.TBsignal¶

Based signal in Time domain

b2u(N) conversion into an uniform signal
plot([ix, col, vline, dtype, hline, dtype, ...]) plot TBsignal
translate(tau) translate signal by tau

TUsignal¶

Uniform time signal

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.TUsignal¶
bsignal.TUsignal¶

Uniform signal in Time domain

This class inheritates from TBsignal and Usignal

fftsh() return an FHsignal

show() show psd

Yadd_zero2r

Etot([tau0, taumax, dB]) Etot calculate the energy of the signal
Efirst(toa[, Tint, sym, dB]) calculate the energy of the first path
Efirst_corr(tau0, Sx, Sy[, dB]) calculate Efirst utilizing the correlation of signal emission et reponse impulsionnelle
Efirst_toath(tau0[, Tint, sym, dB]) calculate Efirst
taumax() calculate taumax
Emax([Tint, sym, dB]) calculate the maximum of Energy integrated over a duration Tint

Class FBsignal¶

Frequency signal

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.FBsignal¶
bsignal.FBsignal¶

FBsignal : Base signal in Frequency domain

plot : plot modulus and phase plotri : plot real part and imaginary part plotdB : plot modulus in dB

plotri([nb]) plot real and imaginary part
plot([phase, dB, ix]) plot
plotdB([mask, n, phase]) usage : plotdB()
stem([color]) stem(self,color=’b- ‘)

Class FUsignal¶

Uniform frequency signal

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.FUsignal¶
bsignal.FUsignal¶

FUsignal : Uniform signal in Frequency domain

MEMBERS
x (,N ) Real y (M x N ) Complex

METHODS + - * symH : force Hermitian symetry –> FHsignal symHz : force Hermitian symetry with zero padding –> FHsignal align : align two FUsignal on a same frequency base

return a list with the two aligned signals

enthrsh : Energy thresholding thresh = 99.99 % dBthrsh : dB thresholding thresh = 40dB ift : Inverse Fourier transform resample : resampling with a new base newdf : resampling with a new df zp : zero padding until len(x) = N

plot : plot modulus and phase plotri : plot real part and imaginary part plotdB : plot modulus in dB get : get k th ray

window([win]) windowing of FU signal
get(k) get the kh signal
info() Display Information on the FUsignal
energy([axis]) calculate energy along given axis
enthrsh([thresh]) dBthrsh : Energy thresholding of an FUsignal
dBthrsh([threshdB]) dBthrsh : dB thresholding of an FUsignal
zp(N) zero padding until length N
newdf(df) resample the FUsignal using phase and module interpolation
dftresamp(df_new)
resample(x_new[, kind]) resample(self,x_new,kind=’linear’):
symH(parity) enforce Hermitian symetry
symHz(Nz) Force Hermitian symmetry with zero padding
align(u2) align <=> intersection
ifft([Npt])
ift([Nz, ffts]) return the associated TUsignal
iftshift([Nz]) apply the inverse fftshift operator to come back in time
show() pcolor visualization of Modulus and Phase
decimate([N]) decimate FUsignal by N

Class FUDsignal¶

Uniform frequency signal with delays

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.FUDsignal¶
bsignal.FUDsignal¶

FUDsignal : Uniform signal in Frequency domain with delays

Attributes :

y : :

tau0 : delay tau1 : additional delay
minphas() construct a minimal phase FUsignal
totud([Nz, ffts]) transform to TUDsignal
iftd([Nz, tstart, tstop, ffts]) time pasting
ft1(Nz[, ffts]) construct CIR from ifft(RTF)
ft2([df]) build channel transfer function (frequency domain)
ftau([Nz, k, ffts]) time superposition

Class FHsignal¶

Frequency hermitian signal

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.FHsignal¶
bsignal.FHsignal¶

FHsignal : Hermitian uniform signal in Frequency domain

ifft : inverse Fourier transform –> TUsignal unrex : unredundant extraction –> FUsignal

ifft([ffts, tt]) Inverse Fourier Transform
unrex() extraction of the non redundant part of a real signal

Class EnImpulse¶

class pylayers.signal.bsignal.EnImpulse¶
bsignal.EnImpulse¶

Create an Energy normalized Gaussian impulse (Usignal)

EnImpulse(x,fc,band,thresh,fe)

fc (GHz) (def = 4GHz) band (GHz) (def = 3GHz) thresh (dB) (def = 10dB) fe (GHz) (def = 100GHz)
